maml:description.maml:para: Clears the EnvironmentToken.
The TargetEnvironment
Clears the cached Azure Active Directory tokens for an environment
Gets the EnvironmentToken.
The TargetEnvironment
Gets the Azure Active Directory Token for a given environment

maml:para.maml:para: Remotely invokes white-listed PS cmdlet on TFE

maml:description.maml:para: PowerShell cmdlet name
All parameters/values that to be passed to cmdlet
Most users will never need to use this cmdlet. Provides low-level configuration information from the Merlin configuration store

maml:para.maml:para: Saves ULSLogRecord objects to a *.log file

maml:description.maml:para: The output filename
The records to save to the log file
If the OutputPath filename already exists, the cmdlet will fail unless -Overwrite or -Append is specified. -Overwrite will replace the existing file.
If the OutputPath filename already exists, the cmdlet will fail unless -Overwrite or -Append is specified. -Append will append to the existing file.

Enable PII Scrubbing. Note that Get-ULSLogs and Import-ULSLogs will scrub PII by default. If you provide -NoScrub to one of those cmdlets, you might want to specify -Scrub parameter here to scrub log data as it is exported to disk.
ULSLogRecords can be created by Get-ULSLogs or Import-ULSLogs. To save those logs back to a text file, pipe the result to Export-ULSLogs

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example retrieves the ULS logs for Grid Manager job 1234, and save the log to the specified logfile

maml:para.maml:para: Saves GridManagerLogRecord objects to a *.log file

maml:description.maml:para: The output filename
The records to save to the log file
If the OutputPath filename already exists, the cmdlet will fail unless -Overwrite or -Append is specified. -Overwrite will replace the existing file.
If the OutputPath filename already exists, the cmdlet will fail unless -Overwrite or -Append is specified. -Append will append to the existing file.

Enable PII Scrubbing. Note that Get-ULSLogs and Import-ULSLogs will scrub PII by default. If you provide -NoScrub to one of those cmdlets, you might want to specify -Scrub parameter here to scrub log data as it is exported to disk.
GridManagerLogRecord can be created by Get-GridLogs or Import-GridLogs. To save those logs back to a text file, pipe the result to Export-GridLogs

dev:remarks.maml:para: Saves the log records from job 1234 to the specified logfile
Saves the log records from job 1234 to the specified logfile, but omits the records with Status of "Ok"

maml:para.maml:para: Saves GenericLogRecord objects to a *.log file

maml:description.maml:para: The output filename
The records to save to the log file
If the OutputPath filename already exists, the cmdlet will fail unless -Overwrite or -Append is specified. -Overwrite will replace the existing file.
If the OutputPath filename already exists, the cmdlet will fail unless -Overwrite or -Append is specified. -Append will append to the existing file.

Enable PII Scrubbing. Note that Get-ULSLogs and Import-ULSLogs will scrub PII by default. If you provide -NoScrub to one of those cmdlets, you might want to specify -Scrub parameter here to scrub log data as it is exported to disk.
GenericLogRecord can be created by Import-GenericLogs or Get-GridFile. To save those logs back to a text file, pipe the result to Export-GenericLogs

maml:para.maml:para: Creates a new UserVoice entry in the Category chosen

maml:description.maml:para: New-FabricFeedback allows engineers to post feedback and suggestions in UserVoice. Entries may be up-voted by other engineers, and teams may create future work items from the feedback and suggestions. The cmdlet will ensure the user wants to create a UserVoice entry versus an issue with Category chosen.

command:example.maml:title: ---------- Example 1 ----------
command:example.dev:code: New-FabricFeedback -Title 'Please add X to Merlin' -Description 'Details about why X should be added to Merlin' -Category Merlin

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a new UserVoice entry with the title and description provided under the Merlin Category.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the AvailabilitySLAImpact.
Gets or sets the Escalation bug id
Gets or sets the end time from when to get the probe results.
Gets or sets the start time from when to get the probe results.
Gets or sets the Farm Id.
Gets or sets the Network Id.
Gets or sets the list of Content DBs
The availability value used in SLA impact calculation. Parameter overrides calculated value.
The impacted site count.
Gets or sets the total site count
Gets or Sets the RW Missed Minutes
Gets or Sets the RO Missed Minutes
Gets or sets the AM probe name. Defaults to Homepage, UploadDoc, and 'My Site Documents' probes
Switch to overwrite any existing bug values
Switch to flag an otherwise DB level escalation as Farm level
Switch to just dry run calculation with out updating Product Studio
Gets or sets the SPMetroPointAlertyTypeId to look for when scanning prevoius alerts
Gets or sets the minutes before end time to set
Gets or sets time the first related alert was raised
Gets or sets the days back to query for site collections
Switch to specify to run the tool against Product Studio DB
Switch to use SPORunners data - this only covers Farm availability, not DB availability

Gets the per site weighted SLA impact of a particular escalation based on BugId and supplied time window. It then updates the bug with calculated values if fields are open, or optionally overwrites existing values

dev:remarks.maml:para: Command gets the bug from Office365Icm Product Studio database and calculates the SLA impact based on the start and stop times supplied. The command will parse farmid, and content db names from bug if applicable. By default it uses the Homepage, UploadDoc, and 'My Site Documents' probes, to determine service availability. It then populates the results back to the Sharepoint Tab of the bug.
Calculates SLA impact of escalation based on probes supplied.
Calculates the SLA impact for farm during supplied window, does not update Product Studio.
Calculates the SLA impact for content dbs

maml:para.maml:para: Retrieves the configuration used by the local Merlin instance, or the service Merlin instance

maml:description.maml:para: If -Local is specified, returns the configuration used by the local PowerShell cmdlets
If -Server is specified, returns the configuration used by the Merlin service
Most users will never need to use this cmdlet. Provides low-level configuration information from the Merlin configuration store
Gets the GridChildItem.
The filepath to list
Optional file pattern to restrict results. By default, this is *.*
If specified, then this cmdlet retrieves files for all subdirectories.
Returns a list of files found in the specified location

maml:para.maml:para: Returns a list of files found in the specified location

maml:description.maml:para: The AlertId associated with the desired result directory
Optional file pattern to restrict results. By default, this is *.*
If specified, then this cmdlet retrieves files for all subdirectories.
If specified, the cmdlet returns the path to the ResultXML filename (rather than the directory name). This file can be the default location for job output.
If specified, returns the Attachments subdirectory. The Attachments subdirectory is used by the Alert infrastructure to attach files to the escalation email
The JobId associated with the desired result directory
Use this cmdlet to get a list of files in the result store. You can then use Get-GridFile to download the PII-scrubbed files to the local machine.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns a directory listing of files associated with the specified job id
Filters the result to the result.xml file associated with the specified job id
Filters the result to the *.htm files associated with the specified job id
Downloads all of the files associated with the specified job id to the current directory. See Get-GridFile for additional examples.

maml:para.maml:para: Imports generic logfiles based upon filepath

maml:description.maml:para: The source location of the file to download
The destination location of the file to download
Allows the cmdlet to overwrite existing files
Streams result lines as individual strings to the PowerShell pipeline
Disable PII Scrubbing
Serialize messages inline in the result set.
Optional hint that might improve performance. If omitted, uses the proxy located alongside the Grid Manager farm
Imports the XML file into the PowerShell pipeline via Import-CliXML
Streams result lines as individual strings to the PowerShell pipeline

As the files are downloaded from the remote datacenter, the PII scrubber processes the contents to remove PII. The resulting file can be saved locally, imported into the local powershell session, or streamed to the console. See examples for more information.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Downloads the specified files from the ResultStore to the current directory.
Downloads the specified files from the ResultStore to the specified directory and overwrites any filename conflicts.
Downloads the specified file to the current directory.
Imports the .XML files from the result store into the current PowerShell pipeline using the Import-CliXml cmdlet
Imports the raw text from the result store into the current PowerShell pipeline using the Get-Content cmdlet
Downloads the *.htm files from the result store to the local directory, and then opens them in the associated application.

maml:para.maml:para: Query, discover and aggregate Grid Manager logs

maml:description.maml:para: Specify the CorrelationId for the HttpRequest
Specify one or more FarmIds to process. If missing or 0, then queries all GFE's
Optionally specify the VMRole's to process.
Restrict log processing to the specified start time.
Restrict log processing to the specified end time.
Apply optional filters. For more information, see 'get-help about_MerlinFilter'.
Disable PII Scrubbing
The JobId to use for finding logfiles.

Optionally specify which step of the job to return. For instance, in DeployVM jobs, step '3' is often used to configure SharePoint. Also supports the following special values: All - Returns all steps First[N] - Returns the first N steps. N is optional, and defaults to '1'. Last[N] - Returns the last N steps. N is optional, and defaults to '1' Both[N] - Returns the first and last N steps. N is optional, and defaults to '1' The default behavior is 'Last1'.

Optionally specify the step retry data to return. A particular step may retry many times, often with the same error. For instance, step 1 of the ActivateFarm job will simply repeatedly retry as it waits for the VM's to r each the Joined state. StepRetryId can specify which retry of each step to return. Supports the following special values: All - Returns all retries First[N] - Returns the first N retries. N is optional, and defaults to '1'. Last[N] - Returns the last N retries. N is optional, and defaults to '1' Both[N] - Returns the first and last N retries. N is optional, and defaults to '1' The default behavior is 'Last1'.
Return the first N execution records
return the last N execution records
Uses an index to optimize searches for Grid Manager logs. Merges discovered log data into a single logfile for easier analysis. If no FarmId is specified, queries logs from all GFE's.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Collects logs for the last execution of the last step of job 1407116
Collects logs for last execution of step 3 of job 1407116
This example finds the most recent execution of job 1407116, and uses powershell to query the results and find a specific record.

Usually, get-gridlog uses the Job Id column of the logfile to find the matching rows. In some cases, it also returns records with jobid = "-1". In general, the job id should never be "-1", but we've found bugs in several SPO deployment scripts that fail to properly set the jobid column. As a result, get-gridlogs currently includes the jobs with "-1" in the jobid column. If you know that your scenario is properly instrumented, it should be safe to ignore rows with the "-1" job id
Gets the Grid log records for the specified JobId and saves the results to the specified filename.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the IcmPipelineHealth.

maml:para.maml:para: Scrubs plain-text for PII strings

maml:description.maml:para: The text to scrub
If specified, then scrubs the entire string as a single unit. By default, the PII pattern match is invoked
If specified, then uses PII pattern matching and applies special handling for XML or HTML
The Get-MerlinScrubbedText cmdlet uses the scrubber configuration from the current Merlin environment
Gets the AvailabilityFromMerlin.
Specify the FarmLabel if you know it. We will append _CONTENT if you don't specify it
Specify your probe name. If a probe starts with DR_, we will assume it is a recovery farm probe
The local endtime, if not specified, we will use the current time
Specify the time range to check. If not specified, we will default to 60 mins
Specify the FarmId and we will query GM for the FarmLabel

Gets the per site weighted SLA impact of a particular escalation based on BugId and supplied time window. It then updates the bug with calculated values if fields are open, or optionally overwrites existing values

dev:remarks.maml:para: Command gets the bug from Office365Icm Product Studio database and calculates the SLA impact based on the start and stop times supplied. The command will parse farmid, and content db names from bug if applicable. By default it uses the Homepage, UploadDoc, and 'My Site Documents' probes, to determine service availability. It then populates the results back to the Sharepoint Tab of the bug.
Calculates SLA impact of escalation based on probes supplied.
Calculates the SLA impact for farm during supplied window, does not update Product Studio.
Calculates the SLA impact for content dbs

maml:description.maml:para: Specify the Device Names to process.
Filters the log events for the specified message string
Restrict log processing to the specified start time in UTC.
Restrict log processing to the specified end time in UTC.
Uses the GFS Nova API to query and report on syslog data from network devices

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the 10 latest syslog entries from the latest hour for the f5 devices running farm 8450
Returns the 10 latest syslog entries from the latest hour for the f5 devices running farm 8450 containing the text "processing"
Returns up to 50 syslog entries between UTC times for the f5 devices running farm 8450
Returns the 100 latest syslog entries from the latest hour for the f5 devices specified

maml:para.maml:para: Query, discover and aggregate ULS logs

maml:description.maml:para: Specify the CorrelationId for the HttpRequest
The time in seconds to wait for the command to execute. The default is 60 seconds
Restrict results to the specified EventId's (or TagId). Allows the user to specify more than one tag to use in the filter.
If specified, then does not modify the Process column to include the server name
If specified, then use this Tenant's Farm to process.
merlin Optionally specify the VMName(s) to process.
Specify a tenant uri.
Specify one or more FarmIds to process. If missing or 0, then queries all GFE's
Optionally specify the VMRole's to process.
Restrict log processing to the specified start time.
Restrict log processing to the specified end time.
Apply optional filters. For more information, see 'get-help about_MerlinFilter'.
Disable PII Scrubbing
The JobId to use for finding logfiles.

Optionally specify which step of the job to return. For instance, in DeployVM jobs, step '3' is often used to configure SharePoint. Also supports the following special values: All - Returns all steps First[N] - Returns the first N steps. N is optional, and defaults to '1'. Last[N] - Returns the last N steps. N is optional, and defaults to '1' Both[N] - Returns the first and last N steps. N is optional, and defaults to '1' The default behavior is 'Last1'.

Optionally specify the step retry data to return. A particular step may retry many times, often with the same error. For instance, step 1 of the ActivateFarm job will simply repeatedly retry as it waits for the VM's to r each the Joined state. StepRetryId can specify which retry of each step to return. Supports the following special values: All - Returns all retries First[N] - Returns the first N retries. N is optional, and defaults to '1'. Last[N] - Returns the last N retries. N is optional, and defaults to '1' Both[N] - Returns the first and last N retries. N is optional, and defaults to '1' The default behavior is 'Last1'.
Return the first N execution records
return the last N execution records
There are 3 major scenarios supported by Get-ULSLogs. Every scenario also supports the -Filter parameter to optionally apply an efficient compiled filter.
1) Find ULS logs related to a given HTTP Request by Correlation Id
2) Find ULS logs related to a Grid job (using JobIndexRecord or JobId)
3) Find ULS logs from a set of machines for a specified time range

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the ULS log records for the specified JobId
Returns the ULS logs with the specified correlation id. The cmdlet might use the Usage database to find the proper time range, and will apply the Correlation Id filter.
Retrieves the ULS log records from every USR in Farm 123 for the last 5 minutes
Gets the ULS log records from www.VerifiedDomainName.com's farm with specified EventId.
Gets the ULS log records for the specified JobId and saves the results to the specified filename.
Gets the ULS log records from a correlation id that can't be parsed for it's timeframe from the USR12345-003 virtual machine in grid farm 12345 between the start time and end time.

Returns the ULS logs with the specified correlation id in the farm that hosts the site. The cmdlet might use the Usage database to find the proper time range, and will apply the Correlation Id filter.

If specified, then does not modify the Process column to include the server name

maml:para.maml:para: Executes a SQL query against the specified database

maml:description.maml:para: The query text to execute
Specify the SQL Server to use in the connection string
Specify the database name to use in the connection string
Specify the database mirror to use in the connection string
Optional hint that might improve performance. If omitted, uses the proxy located alongside the Grid Manager farm
Input files that contain the query text to execute
The interval to wait when attempting to connect to the SQL database. Defaults to 10 seconds.
The interval to wait when executing the SQL command. Defaults to 30 seconds.
A convenience operator to create the @StartTime variable in the SQL statement.
A convenience operator to create the @EndTime variable in the SQL statement.
Allows the script to pass variables directly to the SQL statement. These variables are then available within the SQL text.
If set to $false, ignores any client side validation logic. By default, the cmdlet looks for known bad TSQL, and if found, it will prompt before executing the command.
Disable PII Scrubbing
Specify the database id to query. Will use an available mirror as a failover database.
Specify the site collection of the content database to query. Will use an available mirror as a failover database. Will provide the sql variable @SiteId.
The cmdlet can dynamically add or modify sql variables to allow easy scripting. The query results are returned as a stream of PSObjects
Invokes the DSQuery.
List of properties to load from Active Directory. Supplying a null or empty value will return all properties on the objects.
Disable PII Scrubbing
The root of the active directory tree where the search is started.
The search filter to apply. Supplying a null filter will find all nodes under the search root.
The scope of the return results. Specifices whether to include children of results matching the filter.
Specifies that only the first result matching the filter should be returned.
Optional hint that might improve performance. If omitted, uses the proxy located alongside the Grid Manager farm
Executes an LDAP Query against SPODS
Invokes the DSCountQuery.
The root of the active directory tree where the search is started.
The search filter to apply. Supplying a null filter will find all nodes under the search root.
The scope of the return results. Specifices whether to include children of results matching the filter.
Specifies that only the first result matching the filter should be returned.
Optional hint that might improve performance. If omitted, uses the proxy located alongside the Grid Manager farm
Executes an LDAP Query against SPODS and returns the number of objects matching the query.

maml:para.maml:para: Allows a Merlin user to run a command or series of commands against single or multiple environments.

maml:description.maml:para: The list of environments the command should be executed against
Skip executing the command in these environments
The scriptblock to be executed against each environment
The argument list to be used within the script block
Prompt after each environment completes to run the command on the next environment
Output each environment name to the screen before running the command
Allows the user to skip Ring Validation order. Cmdlet themselves may still enforce the order where order is required or Ring Validation has not been completed.
Run each script block in parallel runspaces. Some local functions or variables will not be available in the child runspace.
If specified, then each result has an additional NoteProperty with the Environment name
Enables a Merlin user to specify a scriptblock against a set of Grid environments. If the user does not enter an environment, all environments are used in Ring Validation order

dev:remarks.maml:para: Runs the command "Get-GridManagerVersion" all environments using Ring Validation order
Runs the command "Get-GridManagerVersion" in the O365Test and EDog environments. EDog will be executed before O365Test to follow Ring Validation
Runs the command "Get-GridManagerVersion" in all the environments returned by Get-MerlinEnvironments cmdlet withn the exception of the Gallatin environment

command:example.maml:title: ---------- Example 4 ----------
command:example.dev:code: Invoke-MerlinCommandEverywhere -ScriptBlock { Get-GridJob -Type PatchOrch -State Suspended } -PassThruWithEnvironment | ft -a Environment,JobId,State,StartTime,Data

dev:remarks.maml:para: Runs the specified command and formats the result as a table with the Environment name

command:example.maml:title: ---------- Example 5 ----------
command:example.dev:code: Invoke-MerlinCommandEverywhere -ScriptBlock { Get-GridJob -Type PatchOrch -State Suspended } -PassThruWithEnvironment -Parallel | ft -a Environment,JobId,State,StartTime,Data

dev:remarks.maml:para: Runs the specified command in Parallel (improving performance by using additional local threads)

maml:para.maml:para: Opens a webpage for the ICM template of the Category chosen

maml:description.maml:para: New-FabricIssue assists engineers in easily creating new incidents in ICM without needing to know the correct Service and Team in ICM.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Opens the correct ICM template to create a new incident under SharePoint SPSE-Service Fabric\Diagnostic for an issue with the Merlin client.

maml:description.maml:para: Specify which endpoint environment to use
Specify the stamp to use.
Specify the credentials to use. By default, uses the current NTLM credentials
Specify if we should only use SSL to connect to this environment
Specifying this switch will prevent Merlin from querying SHN
If specified, the Merlin cmdlets will attempt to directly access the SPO machines and shares. This is primarily intended to be used from the debug box within the datacenter.

In most cases, the Environment would be Edog, ProdBubble, or Prod, but other endpoints might be available as well. Run the 'Get-MerlinEnvironment -ListAvailable' to list all of the available environments

maml:para.maml:para: Gets the current Merlin environment, or lists the available environments

maml:description.maml:para: Returns the raw GMSVR environment variable
If specified, lists all of the available environments.
If specified, lists all Merlin environments including MGD environments

By default, Get-MerlinEnvironment shows the name of the current environment. Specify -RawValue to get the machine name, or -ListAvailable to show all of the available environment names. You may pass any of the Available Environments to the Set-MerlinEnvironment cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns all Farms in the Locator Service where FarmId = 65032
Returns all Tenants in the Locator Service where TenantId = 2381

maml:para.maml:para: Returns Farms from the Locator Service

maml:description.maml:para: A specific Regional Manager
Returns either all Farms in the Locator Service or Farms that reside in a specific Regional Manager.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns all Farms in the DProdMgd1 Regional Manager

maml:para.maml:para: Returns the Regional Manager and the last time Farms and Tenants were synced.

maml:description.maml:para: A specific Regional Manager
Returns the Regional Manager and the last time Farms and Tenants were synced.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns all Regional Managers and the last UTC time the Farms and Tenants in each Regional Manager were synced.
Returns the last UTC datetime that the Farms and Tenants in DProdMgd1 were synced.

maml:para.maml:para: Returns Tenants from the Locator Service

maml:description.maml:para: A specific Regional Manager
Returns all Tenants in the Locator Service that reside in a specific Regional Manager.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns all Tenants in the DProdMgd1 Regional Manager

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the TorusPassword.

maml:para.maml:para: Sends feedback email to the Merlin feature team

maml:description.maml:para: The feedback to send to the feature team
Optional subject to categorize your feedback
If set, then includes a Thumbs-Up icon in the email subject
If set, then includes a Thumbs-Down icon in the email subject
The generated email is sent to the SPODebugReports archive and to the current user.

maml:para.maml:para: Sends an email

maml:description.maml:para: All parameters are optional and have reasonable default values. The email is also CC'd to the SPODebugReports archive.
Gets the OnCallSchedule.
Returns OnCallSchedule for a user. All Dates are UTC. Returns the oncall schedule for a given user.You may use this across various regional managers. Get-OncallSchedule -Alias userAlias
Gets the WhenAmIOnCall.
Returns the oncall schedule for the current user

maml:para.maml:para: Returns Phsyical Machines by rack in the Locator Service.

maml:description.maml:para: The Name of the rack
Returns PhsyicalMachines by rack in the Locator Service. You may execute this cmdlet across various regional managers.

Disables the MerlinFlight.

Disables the MerlinErrorHandling.

maml:para.maml:para: Saves LogRecord objects to a temporary files, and opens the file in ULSViewer

maml:description.maml:para: The records to view
If -Cleanup is specified, attempts to delete any unused temporary files created by Out-ULSViewer or Out-GridLogViewer
LogRecords can be created by Get-GridLogs or Import-GridLogs or Get-ULSLogs or Import-ULSLogs.
